sentences.english: Editor's activities penetratingly judge man's practice.
sentences.chinese: 编辑活动是对人类实践活动的真知灼见的物化。

sentences.english: But there are others who know better.
sentences.chinese: 但是，另有一些人更有真知灼见。

sentences.english: People published a lot of views to this one problem, there is no lack of among them genuine knowledge drinks see.
sentences.chinese: 人们对这一问题发表了许多看法，其中不乏真知酌见。

sentences.english: We often have to relearn a lesson forty or fifty times to really get it.
sentences.chinese: 我们如若真的学会一样真知得经历四五十变的打磨。

sentences.english: Does it offer any insight into the best means of recovery?
sentences.chinese: 它是否对复苏的最好方式有什么真知灼见？

sentences.english: Machiko with jean to rest room.
sentences.chinese: 真知子带琴子去房间休息。

sentences.english: Being familiarized with something does not necessarily mean knowing it well.
Within a few years, Allen was ready to become an Insight trainer.
sentences.chinese: 没花几年，艾伦就准备好成为一名真知课程的培训师。

sentences.english: You'll probably have more perspective in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 到了早晨，你或许会更有真知灼见。

sentences.english: Profound psychological insights glint throughout the stories.
sentences.chinese: 他所有的短篇小说均闪烁着揭示心理活动的真知灼见。

sentences.english: All genuine knowledge originates in direct experience.
sentences.chinese: 一切真知都是从直接经验发源的。

definition: practice/to put into practice/to live up to (a promise)/to carry out (a project)
actual situation/the ultimate essence of things (Buddhism)
to study the underlying principle to acquire knowledge (idiom); pursuing knowledge to the end
doctrine (esp. religious)/argumentation (in a speech or essay)
to study sth to apply it/study for practical applications
to understand/to comprehend the ultimate essence of things (Buddhism)
a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine
to study the underlying principles, esp. in neo-Confucian rational learning 理學|理学[li3 xue2]/word for Western natural sciences during late Qing
